definitions.definition: a single thing, person or group that is complete by itself but can also form part of something larger

examples.text: After 1946 the British Government treated the four territorial divisions as a **single unit**.
The **basic unit** of society is the family.
The cell is the unit of which all living organisms are composed.
the role of the **family unit** in the community

definitions.definition: a single item of the type of product that a company sells

examples.text: The game's selling price was $15 per unit.
What's the **unit cost**?
The manufacturer sold 73 000 units in the first quarter.
China produced 65 million units last year.

definitions.definition: one of the parts into which a textbook or a series of lessons is divided

examples.text: Each unit of the course that we completed felt like a real achievement.
The present perfect is covered in Unit 8.
The university is recruiting staff to teach the new units.
You learned this in the first unit.

definitions.definition: a group of people who work or live together, especially for a particular purpose

examples.text: **army/military/combat/police units**
a **special unit** of the FBI
Medical units were operating in the disaster area.
Two **members of the unit** died on the mission.
They formed **small units** of 15 to 20 people.
The marching column encountered **large units** of the enemy.
Soldiers in the unit are trained to survive in the snow and cold.
The army is collaborating with guerrilla units in the border region.
Enemy units have infiltrated the territory.
The new manager changed a talented collection of individuals into a cohesive unit.
Large departments were broken down into smaller units.

definitions.definition: a department, especially in a hospital, that provides a particular type of care or treatment

examples.text: the **intensive care unit**
a **maternity unit**
The cancer research unit is attached to the local university.
patients in the psychiatric unit

definitions.definition: a piece of furniture, especially a cupboard, that fits with and matches others of the same type

examples.text: a fitted kitchen with white units
floor/wall units
bedroom/kitchen units

definitions.definition: a fixed quantity, etc. that is used as a standard measurement

examples.text: a unit of measurement
Women are advised not to drink more than fourteen units of alcohol per week.
a unit of time/length/weight
a unit of currency, such as the euro or the dollar
Electricity is ten pence per unit.
The law requires almost all federal agencies to use metric units.
The highest carbon emissions per unit of energy are from coal.

definitions.definition: a small machine that has a particular purpose or is part of a larger machine

examples.text: a waste disposal unit
the central processing unit of a computer
an air-conditioning unit

definitions.definition: a single flat, house or section in a building or group of buildings

examples.text: a **housing/residential unit**
to **build** new affordable housing **units**
The site is being redeveloped for 62 **home units**.
a single dwelling unit
a **retail/business unit**
an **industrial unit**
a column for the tens and a column for the units

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (as a mathematical term): from Latin unus, probably suggested by digit.
